title: Moses Reviews Israel’s Journey
summary: Deuteronomy 1 begins Moses’ final speech to Israel. He recounts how God led them from Mount Sinai, the appointment of leaders to help judge the people, the rebellion after the spies’ report, and the resulting 40 years of wandering.

faq.question: Why is Moses retelling Israel’s history?
faq.answer: To remind the new generation of God’s faithfulness and the consequences of disobedience.

faq.question: What event caused Israel to wander for 40 years?
faq.answer: Their refusal to enter the Promised Land after the spies brought a fearful report.
